text.author: Wikinews
text.title: Jack Herrick, wikiHow founder interviewed by Wikinews
text.summary1: (human1) Jack Herrick, founder of the how-to guide website wikiHow, talks to Wikinews about the success of his website, how it differs from his previous venture, eHow, and the reasons why he chose a Creative Commons license for wikiHow, which allows contributors to retain ownership of their content.
text.summary2: (claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022) Wikinews interviews Jack Herrick, founder of the collaborative how-to website wikiHow, about its growth to over 14 million monthly visitors, its mission to build the world's largest how-to manual, and his decision to use Creative Commons licensing.
text.summary3: (gpt4o) In a Wikinews interview, Jack Herrick, wikiHow's founder, discusses its mission to be the largest how-to manual, the use of a Creative Commons license for content forking, its growth to 50,000 articles and 14 million monthly visitors, and the pros and cons of operating as a hybrid organization focused on social good.
text.summary4: (Llama-3.2-3B-Instruct) wikiHow founder Jack Herrick discusses the site's goal of creating a universal how-to manual, its growth to over 50,000 articles and 1,000 featured articles, and its use of a Creative Commons license to foster a community that can fork the site if it strays from its mission.
text.summary5: (Qwen2.5-7B-Instruct) Jack Herrick, founder of wikiHow, discusses the vision behind creating a comprehensive how-to manual accessible to everyone, the challenges faced in implementing a free and open platform, and the growth of the site into a widely-read resource through collaboration and continuous improvement.
